oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Encased daguerreotypes of Cpl. David M. Williams and Sgt. Elijah J. Pirkle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cpl. David M. Williams (l) and his brother-in-law Sgt. Elijah J. Pirkle (r) served in Co. G, 3rd Tenn. Cav., USA. They joined in Cleveland, Tenn. July 1, 1863 and walked to Nashville to muster in. In Sept. 1864, Pirkle was shot near Florence, Alabama. and spent the rest of the war in the hospital. Williams was captured at Sulphur Trestle, Ala., sent to Cahaba Prison (Castle Morgan), Alabama, paroled in Vicksburg, Miss., and survived the Sultana disaster. Additional images show and describe the image case.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Williams, David M.;Pirkle, Elijah J.
